articles.title: Sergio Aguero announces 'I'm going to the World Cup' as Man City legend eyes coaching role with Argentina
articles.description: After being forced into an early retirement due to heart issues, Manchester City legend Sergio Aguero has announced ‘I’m going to the World Cup’
articles.content:
After being forced into an early retirement due to heart issues, Manchester City legend Sergio Aguero has announced ‘I’m going to the World Cup’ as he eyes a coaching role with Argentina.

articles.title: Argentines Schwartzman and Cerundolo to play Rio Open semi
articles.description: RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) — Argentina’s Diego Schwartzman and countryman Francisco Cerundolo will meet in the semifinals of the Rio Open clay-court tourname...
articles.content:
RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) — Argentina’s Diego Schwartzman and countryman Francisco Cerundolo will meet in the semifinals of the Rio Open clay-court tournament.
Third-seeded Schwartzman beat Spain’s Pablo Andujar 7-6 (3), 4-6, 6-4 in the delayed quarterfina... [934 chars]

articles.title: Manu Ginobili, Marques Johnson among 11 Hall of Fame finalists
articles.description: Four-time NBA champion Manu Ginobili of the San Antonio Spurs also led Argentina to an Olympic gold in 2004
articles.content:
LEGEND. Manu Ginobili needs to receive 18 of a possible 24 Hall of Fame votes.
Four-time NBA champion Manu Ginobili of the San Antonio Spurs also led Argentina to an Olympic gold in 2004

articles.title: Italy’s Matteo Berrettini advances to Rio Open quarterfinals
articles.description: Spain's Carlos Alcaraz led Argentina's Federico Delbonis 5-4 when the match was interrupted due to rain.
articles.content:
Matteo Berrettini of Italy beat Brazil's Thiago Monteiro 6-4, 6-7 (6), 6-3 to advance to the quarterfinals. (Twitter)

articles.title: UPDATE 1-Argentina grain inspectors announce strike Monday, no effect on shipments
articles.description: (Changes headline, adds comment from union representative)BUENOS AIRES, Feb 18 (Reuters) - Argentina's grain inspectors union URGARA said on Friday it will launch a 24-hour commercial strike on Monday to demand a wage bonus, but said the strike would not affect grain shipments at ports in one of the world's leading food exporters.URGARA said it is demanding a wage "bonus" for

articles.title: Argentina soy yields could lag drought-hit 2017/18 season in core farm region - exchange

articles.title: Argentina grains inspectors to hold 24-hour strike on Monday - union
articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, Feb 18 (Reuters) - Argentina's grains inspectors will launch a 24-hour nationwide strike next Monday over unmet demands for bonus payments, the URGARA union said on Friday.The union's Secretary General Pablo Palacio said that there had been no offers made by the industry after months of meetings over demands for a 2021 bonus payment."If they do not make an offer
articles.content:
